p: These contentious issues have led to numerous meetings between the delegated experts of the various MS and experts from the Commission, OIE, and EFSA. An agreement or, at least, a compromise was finally reached between what the AHL dictate and what the 28 MS believe are achievable. This compromise, currently in operation, has often proved to be very controversial, e.g., a surveillance/control action to intervene in the beekeeping sector because of varroasis in Italy or France involves thousands of operators while, in Sweden or Finland, it will only affect a few dozen. Reasoned debates during the commissions for elaborating the new Operative Acts or debates passing from good intentions related to risk analysis to everyday reality (such as effects on markets) were tortuous, difficult, and very often hindered by national interests.
